verses.roman:
kulīnagrāmīra bhāgya kahane nā yāya
śūkara carāya ḍoma, seha kṛṣṇa gāya

synonyms: kulīna-grāmīra—the residents of Kulīna-grāma; bhāgya—fortune; kahane—to speak; nā—not; yāya—is possible; śūkara—hogs; carāya—tending; ḍoma—sweeper; seha—he also; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; gāya—chants.
translation: "No one can describe the fortunate position of Kulīna-grāma. It is so sublime that even sweepers who tend their hogs there also chant the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra."
